page.title: 03FINANCE INDUSTRY, ST.HELIER
page.content: Jersey has developed into a major international financial centre since the 1960's thanks to its low taxes, political stability, good worldwide communications and high standard of services. 52 banks and 11 firms of stockbrokers have offices in St.Helier. In 1983 finance centre activities produced 29% of Jersey's income, being the major generator of economic growth. Over 70% of the deposits held by banks in the island are in foreign currencies. Low taxes are the result of careful budgeting to meet local expenditure. Income tax is applied to all incomes at a rate of 20%; there are a limited number of indirect taxes, but no V.A.T., death duties or other taxes on capital. Corporation tax is charged at a flat rate of Â£300 on non-resident incorporated companies only.
